name: wehavemagnums
text: One of the classic early strips.

name: dovey
text:
The first 5 rating strip for me.

(well ok "Phillipe is Standing On It" got a 5 as well, but you kind of have to, don't you?)

name: beefsmipeep
text: Fo shiz

name: mt85
text: Just cast the 1000th vote.  It was a 5

name: mira
text: Philippe is truly lovable. This was established early on.

name: tellumo
text: In deed . The world would be much nicer if we were all in touch with our inner Philippe. Huuuugs!

name: coolbreeze3
text: HUUUUUUUUUUUGGGGGGGGGGGSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSS!!

name: dovey
text: HUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSS

name: em2
text: Way to destroy AssetBar's text wraparound.

name: rasalghul
text: Phillippe is constantly the adorable 5-year-old that every adorable 5-year-old is occasionally.

name: stagnantdisplay
text: Philippe...is...rad!!

name: stanley
text: hilarious

name: overmedicated
text: The first Achewood strip chronologically speaking to make me laugh out loud. The first of many.

name: ford
text: And here we have the fist example of the "Lots of chubbies for apologizing for a basic mistake" phenomenon.

name: fineoakstructure
text: So, should we chubby you for "fist example?"

name: ford
text: I never apologized, but if you wanna come up with reasons to chubby me you will not be stopped.

name: townsend
text: I chubbied you because I felt like it. Thats just how I roll.

name: zapatos
text: I usually roll downhill.

name: mattylite
text: Or should we fist you for the chubby example?

name: qatipay
text:
"The first Achewood strip chronologically speaking to make me laugh out loud"

Yes, me also! At work, naturally.

(crap, what is that earlier post? gah.)

name: catachresis
text: It is a traditional three-panel punchline-based strip, yet it is incredibly, indefinably Achewood.

name: madnes
text: I think this is my favourite Achewood strip. I will read the others to be sure, though.

name: arcibi
text: Like others here, this is the first Achewood I laughed out loud at

name: ambala
text: I find the early days were full of forced togetherness.

name: billyamericana
text: This is a sweetie. Though I like it much better when Phillipe is traumatized tremendously.

name: crumpetsandtea
text: sleeping in the same bed with two much older men? i think his trauma has already begun...

name: chachibenji
text: 3, since a speech bubble is coming from off the screen, either from Lyle or Onstad or something.

name: crumpetsandtea
text: YOOOOOO you're right! O-O

name: mortshire
text: my sense of comedy might be corrupted, but the same joke appeared in my favorite martian (199_).  it was better executed then. :[

name: mystkmanat
text: hey, SHUT UP

name: morganization
text: sheer cuteness

name: jamers
text: I sometimes wish Philippe would regain this level of innocence.

name: mandi
text: This was the strip where I realized "Shit. I'm gonna waste a lot of time here."

name: cuddlefish
text: this has always been a favorite

name: direhaggis
text: Three panels and a spot on punchline. Onstad had something even early on.

name: biggestblackest
text: When did they all get different beds?

name: atticusonline
text: Philippe does not understand the concept of time and words.

name: zapatos
text: Actually he's in an RPG, his HP/MPs are full.

name: mytherciria
text: I see this strip as providing a ridiculously early glimpse at the often misbehaving and selfish Philippe best represented by his blog. Bad otter. Bad.

name: keithcozz
text: To me, this is the 1st "Achewood" that captured the spirit of the strip that it would eventually become.

name: stuart
text:
Is Lyle in bed with them?

Also, my god, Téodor's eyes.

name: lereya
text: And this is the strip where Cornelius and Teodor's ears are finally attached to their heads, instead of stuck on as an afterthought.

name: wae
text: Pre-cats Phillipe!

name: pitseleh
text: It's perfectly natural for several male animals to sleep in the same bed together.

name: tony
text: Philippe takes his nose off before he goes to sleep

name: shoinan
text:
Definitely one of the better earlier strips. I remember a similar joke appearing in Father Ted.

This strip is the first real sign of Onstad's affinity for comics, in that he uses a completely blank second panel to brilliant effect.

name: saturnbeads
text: Who else is in the bed? Teodor looks cute and cuddly with his eyes closed. Phillipe doesn't need to sleep, does he?

name: philosophe
text: Lyle's not cool enough yet to be featured on-screen.

name: dovey
text: Except he's been in strips before this.

name: jackparsons
text: [url=http://penultimate-panel.blogspot.com/[/url] does not do Achewood.

name: wonelove
text:
Too soon.
Much too soon.

name: rbisme
text: no nose

name: idsyen
text: Just fantastic.

name: ravindra108
text:
My favorite strip of all (so far!).
I wish I could give it a new 5 every day!

name: em2
text: The Burns and Allen of Achewood.

name: sparhawk
text: Phillipe no man you gotta think about thisoooooohhhhh nooooo....

name: wonglers
text: Do Teodor and Cornelius still sleep together?  It's kind of weird.

name: rbisme
text: having actually said this dufring a night cap. It does make you feel like special boy.

name: gekimo
text: i have just started reading this.  i am in love

name: kikineko
text: Philippe does not make a good alarm clock.

name: achewhat
text: So cute I could puke. I'm starting to become endeared to this strange little strip.

name: bassguitarbill
text:
"No, Philippe! Too soon!"
Probably the line from Achewood that I quote the most.

name: theguitarhero
text: This is easily my favorite strip. Ever.

name: bit_malik
text:
This comic shows that Phillipe doesn't understand the connection of time with words. He thinks you're only supposed to say "good morning" some amount of time after you say "good night", not actually say it at morning. So he sits and waits and then judges the right time.

He's so silly.

name: theirateturk
text: If my five year old child does not do this I will be most upset : (

name: fakedaisies
text: I love all strips with Philippe. Without fail.

name: art-vader
text: For me this is a joke and observation about the comicstrip-medium itself. Onstad can´t draw 50 panels all dark just to give us an impression of time moving, and seeing how we don´t really get an impression of how long it has taken from panel 1 to 3, Onstad makes a point of just that. I could ofcourse be wrong. I often am
